name: Mixed Document - Lab Report with Annotations
description: Typed laboratory test report with handwritten annotations from clinician highlighting concerns about diagnostic device accuracy.

raw_input.document_content:
CENTRAL LABORATORY SERVICES
===============================================
PATIENT: Johnson, Robert M.        DOB: 05/14/1956
MRN: 4782901                       Collection: 04/01/2024 08:15
ORDERING: Dr. Angela Torres        Received: 04/01/2024 09:30

[HANDWRITTEN: "See attached - MAJOR DISCREPANCY!"]

===============================================
COMPLETE METABOLIC PANEL
===============================================

Test                    Result      Reference      Flag
-------------------------------------------------------
Glucose                 342 H       70-100 mg/dL   HIGH
BUN                     18          7-20 mg/dL
Creatinine              1.1         0.7-1.3 mg/dL
Sodium                  141         136-145 mEq/L
Potassium               4.2         3.5-5.0 mEq/L
Chloride                102         98-106 mEq/L
CO2                     24          22-29 mEq/L
Calcium                 9.4         8.5-10.5 mg/dL

Instrument: GlucoAnalyzer 5000
Serial: GA5K-2022-45123
Calibration: 04/01/2024 06:00

[HANDWRITTEN: "Fingerstick at same time: 185 mg/dL
Patient treated for DKA based on this result!
Re-tested on backup analyzer: 178 mg/dL
This analyzer giving FALSE HIGH readings!"]

===============================================
ADDITIONAL NOTES FROM DR. TORRES (HANDWRITTEN):
===============================================

"I am formally reporting a complaint about the GlucoAnalyzer 5000 (S/N GA5K-2022-45123). This machine reported glucose of 342 mg/dL for my patient. Based on this result, we initiated aggressive IV insulin therapy for presumed DKA.

Point-of-care fingerstick done simultaneously showed 185. When I questioned the discrepancy, lab re-ran on backup analyzer - result was 178.

Patient experienced hypoglycemic episode (BG dropped to 45) due to over-treatment based on falsely elevated result. Required D50 push x2. Patient recovered but this could have been fatal.

I have pulled this analyzer from service. Lab lot # GA-2024-Q1-089. This is the THIRD glucose discrepancy I've seen this month on this machine. Please investigate urgently.

Dr. Angela Torres, MD
Internal Medicine
04/02/2024
Contact: atorres@centralmed.org or (555) 892-7700 x445"

event_info.event_description: Laboratory glucose analyzer reported falsely elevated glucose (342 mg/dL) when actual value was approximately 178-185 mg/dL. Patient treated for DKA with aggressive insulin therapy based on false result. Patient developed hypoglycemia (glucose 45 mg/dL) requiring emergency dextrose administration.
event_info.patient_outcome: Hypoglycemic episode (BG 45) due to over-treatment, required D50 x2, recovered
event_info.device_outcome: Analyzer removed from service by physician
event_info.location: Central Laboratory Services / Central Med hospital

expected_complaint.narrative: Physician reports GlucoAnalyzer 5000 (S/N GA5K-2022-45123) gave falsely elevated glucose reading of 342 mg/dL. Simultaneous fingerstick was 185 mg/dL, backup analyzer showed 178 mg/dL. Patient treated for presumed DKA with aggressive IV insulin based on false high reading. Patient developed hypoglycemia (glucose 45) requiring emergency D50 administration x2. Third glucose discrepancy on this machine this month. Analyzer removed from service.

ground_truth.coding_rationale: A0803 (Inaccurate Result) or A0801 (False Positive Result) for falsely elevated glucose reading. C0902 (Hypoglycemia) for patient outcome. MDR required - patient had serious hypoglycemic event that could have been fatal, directly caused by device malfunction.

extraction_challenges: Must identify complaint vs routine lab report
notes: Complex document requiring synthesis of typed lab results and handwritten clinical annotations. Tests ability to identify device malfunction from clinical context. High priority case due to patient harm and pattern of repeated issues.
